mlr3mbspls 0.2.11

Sequential Component-wise Tuner for Group-Sparse MB-sPCA

Source: R/TunerSeqMBsPCA.R
TunerSeqMBsPCA.Rd

TunerSeqMBsPCA tunes one component at a time for PipeOpMBsPCA, choosing a block-sparsity vector c that maximises cross-validated total variance explained. After each component it refits on the full residuals, performs an optional permutation test for significance, and-if significant-deflates all blocks before proceeding to the next component.

The public interface mirrors TunerSeqMBsPLS; only the objective (variance explained rather than latent correlation) and the C++ back-end differ.

Value

A tuned TuningInstance (invisibly). The result is written to the instance via assign_result() with learner_param_vals = list(c_matrix = <matrix>) and the best inner objective value under the key "mbspca.mean_ev".

Works with

A learner whose pipeline contains a PipeOpMBsPCA named "mbspca". The tuner writes the chosen sqrt(L1) budgets into param_vals$c_matrix (blocks x components) of that pipeop.

Construction

TunerSeqMBsPCA$new(tuner = "random_search", budget = 100L, resampling = mlr3::rsmp("cv", folds = 3), parallel = "none", early_stopping = TRUE, n_perm = 1000L, perm_alpha = 0.05)

Optimisation procedure

For component k, a search space over integer proxies c_b in [1, p_b] is defined per block (p_b = #features). The objective evaluates CV mean of total variance explained. The optimal integers are mapped to sqrt(L1) budgets via sqrt(c_b) and stored in column k of c_matrix. Residuals are deflated and the procedure continues for the next component (up to the requested maximum, possibly shortened by early stopping).

See also

PipeOpMBsPCA, mlr3tuning::Tuner, bbotk::bbotk

Super class

mlr3tuning::Tuner -> TunerSeqMBsPCA

Method new()

Create a new TunerSeqMBsPCA.

Usage

TunerSeqMBsPCA$new(
  tuner = "random_search",
  budget = 100L,
  resampling = rsmp("cv", folds = 3),
  parallel = "none",
  early_stopping = TRUE,
  n_perm = 1000L,
  perm_alpha = 0.05
)

Arguments

tuner

character(1). Inner optimizer ID (e.g., "random_search").

budget

integer(1). Number of evaluations per component (default 100).

resampling

Resampling. Template for inner CV (default rsmp("cv", folds = 3)).

parallel

character(1). "none" or "inner" (future-based parallel fold evals).

early_stopping

logical(1). Enable permutation early stopping (default TRUE).

n_perm

integer(1). Number of permutations if early stopping is enabled.

perm_alpha

numeric(1). Significance level for permutation test.

Method optimize()

Run the sequential tuning loop.

Usage

TunerSeqMBsPCA$optimize(instance)

Arguments

instance

mlr3tuning::TuningInstanceSingleCrit (or compatible). The outer instance to populate.

Returns

The modified instance (invisibly).

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

TunerSeqMBsPCA$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(mlr3)
library(mlr3pipelines)
library(mlr3tuning)
blocks = list(eng = c("disp", "hp", "drat"), body = c("wt", "qsec"))
po = PipeOpMBsPCA$new(blocks = blocks, param_vals = list(ncomp = 3))
lrn = as_learner(po %>>% po("regr.ranger"))

ti = TuningInstanceSingleCrit$new(
  task = tsk("mtcars"),
  learner = lrn,
  resampling = rsmp("holdout"),
  measure = msr("regr.rmse"),
  search_space = ps(), # outer space unused; tuner overrides mbspca internals
  terminator = trm("none")
)
TunerSeqMBsPCA$new(budget = 50)$optimize(ti)
ti$result_learner_param_vals$c_matrix
} # }
